titlealts.searchtitle: NHS Business Definition: Long Term Physical Health Condition - Description

body.p: A Long Term Physical Health Condition is a PATIENT DIAGNOSIS .
A Long Term Physical Health Condition (also known as a Chronic Condition ) is:

div.p: A health problem that requires ongoing management over a period of years or decades
One that cannot currently be cured but can be controlled with the use of medication and/or other therapies.

body.p: This includes a wide range of health conditions including:

div.p: Non-communicable diseases (e.g. cancer and cardiovascular disease)
Communicable diseases (e.g. Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) / Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome (AIDS))
Certain mental disorders (e.g. schizophrenia, depression) and
Ongoing impairments in structure (e.g. blindness, joint disorders).

body.p: Examples of Long Term Physical Health Conditions include:

div.p: Chronic Respiratory (e.g. Asthma, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD))
Other Long Term Conditions (e.g. Chronic Fatigue Syndrome, Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), Cancer) etc.
